00020 #ifndef MOVE_H
00021 #define MOVE_H
00022 
00023 #include <string>
00024 #include <cmath>
00025 
00026 #include <omnetpp.h>
00027 
00028 #include "Coord.h"
00029 #include "BaseUtility.h"
00030 #include "ImNotifiable.h"
00031 
00046 class Move : public BBItem {
00047 //class Move {
00048     BBITEM_METAINFO(BBItem);
00049 
00050  public:
00052     Coord startPos;
00054     simtime_t startTime;
00056     Coord direction;
00058     double speed;
00059 
00060 public:
00061     void setDirection(const Coord& target) {
00062 
00063       double d = startPos.distance( target );
00064       direction = (target - startPos) / d;
00065 
00066         //double d = sqrt(dir.x*dir.x + dir.y*dir.y);
00067         //direction.x = dir.x/d;
00068         //direction.y = dir.y/d;
00069     }
00070 
00071     /*
00072      * @brief Returns the position of the Move (Host) at the specified point in time.
00073      * It is intended to be passed simTime() as actualTime and returns the actual position.
00074      *
00075      * Assumes that direction represents a normalized vector (length equals 1.0).
00076      * Further this function does not check whether the given time point is before
00077      * the startTime of the actual move pattern. So in this case one might obtain
00078      * an unintended result.
00079      *
00080      */
00081     virtual Coord getPositionAt(simtime_t actualTime) const
00082     {
00083       // if speed is very close to 0.0, the host is practically standing still
00084       if ( FWMath::close(speed, 0.0) ) return startPos;
00085 
00086       // otherwise: actualPos = startPos + ( direction * v * t )
00087       return startPos + ( direction * speed * SIMTIME_DBL(actualTime - startTime) );
00088     }
00089 
00090 public:
00091 
00092     std::string info() const {
00093         std::ostringstream ost;
00094         ost << " HostMove "
00095             << " startPos: " << startPos.info()
00096             << " direction: " << direction.info()
00097             << " startTime: " << startTime
00098             << " speed: " << speed;
00099         return ost.str();
00100     }
00101 };
00102 
00103 #endif
